description.narrative: The project aims at creating a non-sectarian female political environment and increasing female representation in the Lebanese parliament through the following main actions: 1- Create a female platform that will encourage and support more women to run for office in the next national elections. 2- Raise Awareness on the benefits of engaging women in politics. 3- Increase visibility of participants in their communities and political sphere. 4- Build a new parliament with gender equality by instating a gender quota of 33% at least. Participants can be independent or politically affiliated.
"The NYOU Parliament" is a project managed and organized by Fiftyfifty and supported by the Kingdom of Netherlands' embassy in Beirut.

recipient-country.narrative: The NYOU Parliament project aims at supporting female candidates in the next Lebanese Parliamentary elections and building a new parliament with gender equality by instating a gender quota of 33% at least.

tag.narrative: "The NYOU Parliament" project aims at supporting female candidates to run for 2022 Lebanese Parliamentary Elections and build a new parliament with gender equality by instating a gender quota of 33% at least

description.narrative: Appendix 1 is the design of the branding materials; Logo / Brochure / Roll-up banner of the project "The NYOU Parliament".

Fiftyfifty developed the application form taking into consideration our previous experience across different programs specifically "Counselling Office for Women in Politics - COWP" - funded by the Netherlands. The application must: - Assess the eligibility, knowledge, and experience of applicants - Get the most information relevant to applicants and their political experience and backgrounds. - Respond to areas that will be highly weighted in our scorecards rating: i.e.: politically active, willing to run for office, etc.

title.narrative: The NYOU Parliament - 6-month report1 - Dec19 till May20.

description.narrative: The uploaded pdf document is the 6-month report of the inception phase from December 2019 till May 2020
